action.action-desc: Mr. Perry (for himself, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Norman, Mr. Good of Virginia, Mr. Duncan, Mr. Reschenthaler, Mr. Posey, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Lamborn, and Mr. Burlison) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit Federal funding to the Wuhan Institute of Virology and to require a GAO study regarding Federal funds previously provided to such institute or to entities affiliated with the Chinese Government.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defund the Wuhan Institute of Virology Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funding to the Wuhan Institute of Virology

subsection.text: No funds authorized or appropriated by Federal law may be made available to the Wuhan Institute of Virology for any purpose.

Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct a study and submit a report to Congress regarding the amount of Federal funds that were awarded or indirectly provided (whether purposely or inadvertently) during the 15-year period immediately preceding such date of enactment to—

paragraph.text: the Wuhan Institute of Virology, including affiliated researchers;
any agency or instrumentality of the entities listed in paragraphs (1) through (3).
